epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_code: NSW - Brunswick Heads - Climate Active - NZ402L
product_description.product_use: General use concrete including footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete

product_classification.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
product_classification.special_class: High-strength/high-performance concrete, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification_dangerous_goods: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

deconstruction.process: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: End-of-life fate assumed based on common scenarios; 100% product separately collected; recycling produces recycled aggregate replacing virgin coarse aggregate

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) not included in this EPD but recommended to consider in whole-of-life studies

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR2019:14 V1.3.4 (2024)
Man Yu et al., The Carbon Footprint of Australia's Construction Sector, Procedia Engineering, 2017
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks
Ionising radiation indicator excludes effects from nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal underground
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing
Environmental impact indicators with high uncertainty or limited experience should be used with care
additional_info.notes: This publication supersedes all previous literature on this subject. Specifications and details may change; users must verify current information with Holcim Customer Service. This publication is for general information only and not a substitute for professional technical engineering advice.
